conclusion: Analyze the process step-by-step to determine work done from D to A.
Transition from D to A is isobaric with constant pressure P1 and volume decreases from V2 to V1.
Work done in an isobaric process is given by W = P ΔV.
Change in volume ΔV is V1 - V2.
Calculate work done: W = P1 (V1 - V2).
Since ΔV is negative, work done by gas is negative, indicating work is done on the gas.
Work done by the gas on the surroundings is the absolute value: P1 (V2 - V1).
